text: <@UPZ4VTLJE> I have been looking at bringing on a contractor or two. How did you get started creating SOPs? I feel like that is going to be a struggle for me

elements.text: I have been looking at bringing on a contractor or two. How did you get started creating SOPs? I feel like that is going to be a struggle for me

text:
<@U034NCQDL4C> these are great points! I am actually torn between just hiring contractors for all the stuff I don't want to do and scaling to an actual agency.

I enjoy writing, obviously. I see value and purpose in my work. But there are some clients where I would rather train someone to do it and not have to do the actual writing again :laughing:

These are great things to think about, though!

text: Do you mean a brand messaging guide? It's probably similar, but I price it at $300 on fiverr.

elements.text: Do you mean a brand messaging guide? It's probably similar, but I price it at $300 on fiverr.

text:
First, brainstorm a list of tasks that you currently do that you think could potentially be outsourced. Start small and work your way up throughout the service delivery process.

Then, on the next project when you’re going to complete one of those tasks, fire up Google Docs and make a quick outline of the steps you’re going to take to create the task.

Then, start working on the task, step by step, and build out each step into an outline as you’re working on it. Take screenshots and add detail as you can, but the bare minimum output is a basic outline. You can then fill in the details with screenshots, links, and video afterward.

When you bring on your first contractor, give them access to the Google Doc and walk them through the process on Zoom. Let them know if they see any discrepancies, errors, opportunities to improve, to make a comment in the doc.

Build out a Google Drive folder for these SOPs and create a folder structure organized by department/strategy/task type and store each doc accordingly. Also go into your Project Management tool and add a link to relevant docs and folders from within your task templates.

If you don’t have task templates set up for recurring projects in your project management system, that’s a whole other thread ;)
